Package game

Class FlyingUpdater

java.lang.Object
game.FlyingUpdater
All Implemented Interfaces:
city.cs.engine.StepListener, EventListener
public class FlyingUpdater extends Object implements city.cs.engine.StepListener
Implements periodic updates for a flying enemy's behavior within the game.

This class implements StepListener to consistently apply updates to a FlyingEnemy's behavior each time the physics world steps forward. This is particularly important for dynamic behaviors such as pursuing the player or reacting to game events. The updates are applied during the post-step phase to ensure that all physics calculations for the step are complete.

Since:
1.0

  • Constructor Details

    • FlyingUpdater

      public FlyingUpdater(FlyingEnemy flyingEnemy)
      Constructs an updater for a specific flying enemy.

      This constructor initializes the updater with a reference to the flying enemy it will manage. This setup allows the updater to directly invoke behavior-modifying methods on the flying enemy after each physics step, ensuring the enemy's actions remain consistent with the game's state.

      Parameters:
      flyingEnemy - The flying enemy to be updated.

  • Method Details

    • preStep

      public void preStep(city.cs.engine.StepEvent e)
      No actions are taken before the physics step.
      Specified by:
      preStep in interface city.cs.engine.StepListener
      Parameters:
      e - The event details of the pre-step phase.

    • postStep

      public void postStep(city.cs.engine.StepEvent e)
      Updates the flying enemy's behavior after each physics step.

      This method is called after the physics world has processed a step, ensuring that any changes to the flying enemy's behavior (like movement or AI decisions) are applied based on the latest game state. It specifically invokes the update method of the FlyingEnemy class, which might handle complex behaviors like adjusting trajectory towards the player.

      Specified by:
      postStep in interface city.cs.engine.StepListener
      Parameters:
      e - The event details of the post-step phase.
